servinfosub.title: DTC Detecting Condition and Trouble Area

ptxt.emph: P0131: O2 Sensor (HO2S) Circuit Low Voltage (Bank-1 Sensor-1)

entry.ptxt: This DTC is detected if any one of the following conditions is met.

item.ptxt: Output voltage of A/F sensor signal circuit (+) is lower than 1.6 V for 5 sec.
Output voltage of A/F sensor signal circuit (–) is lower than 0.7 V for 5 sec.

ptxt.emph: P0132: O2 Sensor (HO2S) Circuit High Voltage (Bank-1 Sensor-1)

entry.ptxt: This DTC is detected if any one of the following conditions is met.

item.ptxt: Output voltage of A/F sensor signal circuit (+) is higher than 2.8 V for 5 sec.
Output voltage of A/F sensor signal circuit (–) is higher than 2.7 V for 5 sec.

ptxt.emph: P0134: O2 Sensor (HO2S) No Activity Detected (Bank-1 Sensor-1)

entry.ptxt: Impedance of A/F sensor element is higher than 50 Ω for 20 sec. even if sensor heater is turned ON for 20 sec.

ptxt.emph: P2195: O2 Sensor Signal Stuck Lean (Bank-1 Sensor-1)

entry.ptxt: A/F mixture output from A/F sensor is lean state for 10 sec. even if HO2S signal circuit is higher than 0.2 V (rich state).

ptxt.emph: P2196: O2 Sensor Signal Stuck Rich (Bank-1 Sensor-1)

entry.ptxt: A/F mixture output from A/F sensor is rich state for 10 sec. even if HO2S signal circuit is lower than 0.7 V (lean state).

ptxt.emph: P2237: O2 Sensor Positive Current Control Circuit / Open

entry.ptxt: Impedance of A/F sensor element is higher than 500 Ω for 15 sec. even if A/F sensor heater is turned ON for 20 sec.

attention3.ptxt: If DTC other than aimed DTC are previously detected in DTC confirmation procedure, be sure to troubleshoot DTC previously detected.

s1.ptxt: Start engine and warm up to normal operating temperature.
Run engine at idle speed for 1 min.
Start engine and warm up to normal operating temperature.
Run engine at idle speed for 2 min.

attention3.ptxt: Check to make sure that the following condition is satisfied when using this procedure.

s1.ptxt: Start engine and warm up to normal operating temperature.
Drive vehicle at 50 – 60 km/h (31 – 37 mile/h) (engine speed: 1,500 – 3,000 rpm) for 3 min. (Keep throttle valve opening constantly in this step.)

testgroup.question: Was “Engine and Emission Control System Check” performed?

action.ptxt: Go to Engine and Emission Control System Check:J24B .

testgroup.title: DTC check
testgroup.question: Is there any DTC(s) other than P0131, P0132, P0134, P2195, P2196 and P2237?

action.ptxt: Go to troubleshooting for applicable DTC.

test1.ptxt: Turn OFF ignition switch and disconnect connectors from A/F sensor and ECM.
Check for proper terminal connection to A/F sensor and ECM connectors.
Check that A/F sensor signal circuits (A3 – A4) are as follows.

item.ptxt: Wiring harness resistance of each A/F sensor signal circuit is less than 3 Ω.
Insulation resistance between each A/F sensor signal circuit and vehicle body ground is infinity.
Insulation resistance of wire harness is infinity between each A/F sensor signal terminal and each terminal at A/F sensor connector.
Circuit voltage of each A/F sensor signal circuit is 0 – 1 V with ignition switch in ON position.

action.ptxt: Repair or replace defective wire harness.

testgroup.title: DTC recheck

test1.ptxt: Perform DTC confirmation procedure and check DTC.

testgroup.question: Is DTC P0131, P0132, P0134, P2195, P2196 and P2237 still detected?

action.ptxt: Substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.
